Title: An update for llama.cpp is now available for openEuler-24.03-LTS-SP2

Notes.Text: An update for llama.cpp is now available for openEuler-24.03-LTS-SP2
Notes.Title: Summary

Notes.Text:
Security Fix(es):

llama.cpp is an inference of several LLM models in C/C++. Prior to version b5721, there is a signed vs. unsigned integer overflow in llama.cpp's tokenizer implementation (llama_vocab::tokenize) (src/llama-vocab.cpp:3036) resulting in unintended behavior in tokens copying size comparison. Allowing heap-overflowing llama.cpp inferencing engine with carefully manipulated text input during tokenization process. This issue has been patched in version b5721.(CVE-2025-52566)
Notes.Title: Description

Notes.Text:
An update for llama.cpp is now available for openEuler-24.03-LTS-SP2.

openEuler Security has rated this update as having a security impact of high. A Common Vunlnerability Scoring System(CVSS)base score,which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVElink(s) in the References section.
Notes.Title: Topic

Vulnerabilities.Note: llama.cpp is an inference of several LLM models in C/C++. Prior to version b5721, there is a signed vs. unsigned integer overflow in llama.cpp's tokenizer implementation (llama_vocab::tokenize) (src/llama-vocab.cpp:3036) resulting in unintended behavior in tokens copying size comparison. Allowing heap-overflowing llama.cpp inferencing engine with carefully manipulated text input during tokenization process. This issue has been patched in version b5721.
